channel.title: Inoreader / @Inoreader

item.title: R to @egaode1192: We don't have any known issues at the moment. Please try to change between http://www.inoreader.com and http://jp.inoreader.com and see which one works for you. This could be a temporary networking issue.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: We don't have any known issues at the moment. Please try to change between inoreader.com and jp.inoreader.com and see which one works for you. This could be a temporary networking issue.

item.title: R to @BeyondLimits99: We are looking into it. Thanks for the suggestion.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: We are looking into it. Thanks for the suggestion.

item.title: R to @TheMerovius: Hopefully we won’t disappoint. Our support is always available should you need something. The contact link is in the sidebar.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: Hopefully we won’t disappoint. Our support is always available should you need something. The contact link is in the sidebar.

item.title:
RT by @Inoreader: duplicate filters in @Inoreader work really well
100+ items removed for today = ~5min, so i now have half an hour more every week #optimization
item.dc:creator: @AlexRChampagne
item.description:
duplicate filters in @Inoreader work really well

100+ items removed for today = ~5min, so i now have half an hour more every week #optimization

item.title: R to @benbvi3ws: But we already do: https://www.inoreader.com/blog/2019/03/introducing-a-new-rule-action-webhooks.html
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: But we already do: inoreader.com/blog/2019/03/i…

item.title: R to @frequentcoder: We don't have any recorded issues in the past few hours. Did you try with a different connection (wifi/mobile)? You can temporarily use http://us.inoreader.com when you can't reach our main service for some reason.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: We don't have any recorded issues in the past few hours. Did you try with a different connection (wifi/mobile)? You can temporarily use us.inoreader.com when you can't reach our main service for some reason.

item.title: R to @BoyEatsWaffles: That's easy. You need to set up a simple rule that will forward all articles in a selected feed as a push notification. https://www.inoreader.com/blog/2015/04/introducing-push-notifications-get-most.html
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: That's easy. You need to set up a simple rule that will forward all articles in a selected feed as a push notification. inoreader.com/blog/2015/04/i…

item.title: R to @asolepascual: No, we are getting timeout errors to http://nitter.net from our backend. It looks like we are being blocked, because the feeds are working from another network in our area.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: No, we are getting timeout errors to nitter.net from our backend. It looks like we are being blocked, because the feeds are working from another network in our area.

item.title: R to @Daniel_Rubino: It looks like at some point this feed was sending a 301 (permanent) redirect to https://www.windowscentral.com/rss, which now returns a 404 error. I just removed the redirect and the feed started working. However, please use 301 redirects with care as we respect the "permanent" part.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: It looks like at some point this feed was sending a 301 (permanent) redirect to windowscentral.com/rss, which now returns a 404 error. I just removed the redirect and the feed started working. However, please use 301 redirects with care as we respect the "permanent" part.

item.title: R to @wagnmw: No issues here. Have you tried with a different connection (Wi-Fi/mobile)? Maybe a temporary routing issue. Try to use http://us.inoreader.com until it’s fixed.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: No issues here. Have you tried with a different connection (Wi-Fi/mobile)? Maybe a temporary routing issue. Try to use us.inoreader.com until it’s fixed.

item.title: R to @MarcRossinyol: Sounds interesting, but not like anything we've done in the past. We don't have this kind of relationship with publishers yet, and it can get quite complicated before you know it. We'll explore this possibility though. Thanks for the tip!
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: Sounds interesting, but not like anything we've done in the past. We don't have this kind of relationship with publishers yet, and it can get quite complicated before you know it. We'll explore this possibility though. Thanks for the tip!

item.title: R to @radoncnotes: We'll check it out. Thanks!
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: We'll check it out. Thanks!

item.title: R to @Philip_btu: Please get in touch with support@inoreader.com. We have a Student plan that we can enable for you.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: Please get in touch with support@inoreader.com. We have a Student plan that we can enable for you.

item.title: R to @bascht: No such known bugs here... Are you using any other 3rd party app to access Inoreader? P.S. you can long-press on the Mark all as read button to choose an interval and it can actually restore your unread states in this interval (w/out manually read articles).
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: No such known bugs here... Are you using any other 3rd party app to access Inoreader? P.S. you can long-press on the Mark all as read button to choose an interval and it can actually restore your unread states in this interval (w/out manually read articles).

item.title: R to @ThatGirl0903: Sure! Just scroll to the bottom of the list and you'll see the option to organize the sharing tools.
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: Sure! Just scroll to the bottom of the list and you'll see the option to organize the sharing tools.

item.title: R to @killyourfm: In Inoreader, simply paste the YouTube channel’s URL and the feed will be automatically detected. Oh and if that’s too much of a bother, you can simply keep your YouTube subscriptions in sync with Inoreader through this integration: https://www.inoreader.com/blog/2020/04/keep-your-youtube-subscriptions-in-sync-with-inoreader.html
item.dc:creator: @Inoreader
item.description: In Inoreader, simply paste the YouTube channel’s URL and the feed will be automatically detected. Oh and if that’s too much of a bother, you can simply keep your YouTube subscriptions in sync with Inoreader through this integration: inoreader.com/blog/2020/04/k…
